        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Mar 20, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Mar 20, 2023)
      </option>

      <div class="select-container">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This sounds like a potential memory issue based on observed behavior and<span class="line"><!---->This sounds like a potential memory issue based on observed behavior and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crbug.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crbug.com"><!---->crbug.com<!----></a> searches for similar crashes.<span class="line"><!----> searches for similar crashes.<!----></span><br>Found this on Stable, have crash dump and some context. Still trying to repro again.<span class="line"><!---->Found this on Stable, have crash dump and some context. Still trying to repro again.<!----></span><br><br>I had a background tab open on WebsiteA ("Tab 1") and an email tab on WebsiteB ("Tab 2"). I stepped away from laptop for 30-60 minutes (on Windows lockscreen the whole time).<span class="line"><!---->I had a background tab open on WebsiteA ("Tab 1") and an email tab on WebsiteB ("Tab 2"). I stepped away from laptop for 30-60 minutes (on Windows lockscreen the whole time).<!----></span><br>When I returned, from my email I opened a link to WebsiteA using ctrl+click (to open link in new background tab) which created "Tab 3". After a couple of seconds I switched to the new tab (Tab 3) for WebsiteA, and saw it was in a crashed state.<span class="line"><!---->When I returned, from my email I opened a link to WebsiteA using ctrl+click (to open link in new background tab) which created "Tab 3". After a couple of seconds I switched to the new tab (Tab 3) for WebsiteA, and saw it was in a crashed state.<!----></span><br><br>More interestingly, I then switched to the original tab for WebsiteA (Tab 1) and the page was blank (instead of an error page indicating a renderer kill). I then looked at Chrome's Task Manager to see if the renderer process for WebsiteA was still running, but as far as I could tell it was not (or at least not associated with the tab page's title). I refreshed the page which then loaded the original page on Tab 1 normally.<span class="line"><!---->More interestingly, I then switched to the original tab for WebsiteA (Tab 1) and the page was blank (instead of an error page indicating a renderer kill). I then looked at Chrome's Task Manager to see if the renderer process for WebsiteA was still running, but as far as I could tell it was not (or at least not associated with the tab page's title). I refreshed the page which then loaded the original page on Tab 1 normally.<!----></span><br><br>The blank page on Tab 1 suggests to me that the renderer for Tab 1 went away somehow either before or after the crash of Tab 3. How or why is a mystery. I suspect Tab 3 tried to use the renderer process for Tab 1 (as expected, since it's same origin), but since something happened to Tab 1's renderer process, that led to the bad memory read on Tab 3.<span class="line"><!---->The blank page on Tab 1 suggests to me that the renderer for Tab 1 went away somehow either before or after the crash of Tab 3. How or why is a mystery. I suspect Tab 3 tried to use the renderer process for Tab 1 (as expected, since it's same origin), but since something happened to Tab 1's renderer process, that led to the bad memory read on Tab 3.<!----></span><br><br>IIRC the error shown in the crashed Tab 3 was STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION (or something else which wasn't a breakpoint) which prompted me to look into it further.<span class="line"><!---->IIRC the error shown in the crashed Tab 3 was STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION (or something else which wasn't a breakpoint) which prompted me to look into it further.<!----></span><br><br>windbg !analyze output suggests a non-null read, but unsure why/where without symbolized stack trace (which I don't have because it was on Stable, not ASan). See attached windbg-analysis.txt for full output and attached dump.<span class="line"><!---->windbg !analyze output suggests a non-null read, but unsure why/where without symbolized stack trace (which I don't have because it was on Stable, not ASan). See attached windbg-analysis.txt for full output and attached dump.<!----></span><br><br>READ_ADDRESS:  000002e6015b0100 <span class="line"><!---->READ_ADDRESS:  000002e6015b0100 <!----></span><br><br>ERROR_CODE: (NTSTATUS) 0xc0000005 - The instruction at 0x%p referenced memory at 0x%p. The memory could not be %s.<span class="line"><!---->ERROR_CODE: (NTSTATUS) 0xc0000005 - The instruction at 0x%p referenced memory at 0x%p. The memory could not be %s.<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_CODE_STR:  c0000005<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_CODE_STR:  c0000005<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_PARAMETER1:  0000000000000000<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_PARAMETER1:  0000000000000000<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_PARAMETER2:  000002e6015b0100<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_PARAMETER2:  000002e6015b0100<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>FAILURE_BUCKET_ID:  INVALID_POINTER_READ_c0000005_chrome.dll!Unknown<span class="line"><!---->FAILURE_BUCKET_ID:  INVALID_POINTER_READ_c0000005_chrome.dll!Unknown<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 Stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 Stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2728)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2728)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>See description above for context. Don't have exact repro steps at the moment, but vaguely:<span class="line"><!---->See description above for context. Don't have exact repro steps at the moment, but vaguely:<!----></span><br>1. Open tab to WebsiteA ("Tab 1")<span class="line"><!---->1. Open tab to WebsiteA ("Tab 1")<!----></span><br>2. Open tab to WebsiteB ("Tab 2") with link to WebsiteA<span class="line"><!---->2. Open tab to WebsiteB ("Tab 2") with link to WebsiteA<!----></span><br>3. Wait (+ ???)<span class="line"><!---->3. Wait (+ ???)<!----></span><br>4. On WebsiteB (Tab 2), ctrl+click link to WebsiteA to open new background tab ("Tab 3")<span class="line"><!---->4. On WebsiteB (Tab 2), ctrl+click link to WebsiteA to open new background tab ("Tab 3")<!----></span><br>5. Switch to new background tab (Tab 3)<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch to new background tab (Tab 3)<!----></span><br><br>Observed: Tab 3 shows error page, Tab 1 is blank<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Tab 3 shows error page, Tab 1 is blank<!----></span><br>Expected: Page in Tab 3 loaded normally, Tab 1 is shown normally<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Page in Tab 3 loaded normally, Tab 1 is shown normally<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: Renderer (tab)<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: Renderer (tab)<!----></span><br>Crash State: Will attach dmp and windbg analysis in comment<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: Will attach dmp and windbg analysis in comment<!----></span><br>Client ID (if relevant): 795a64cb3813584e (crash ID from chrome://crashes)<span class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): 795a64cb3813584e (crash ID from chrome://crashes)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Is this crash reproducible?<span class="line"><!---->Is this crash reproducible?<!----></span><br>We don't get any information from the magic signature, as this is just an indication of some form of memory corruption with all possible root causes you can imagine (a bug *somewhere*, memory corruption, faulty hardware, etc).<span class="line"><!---->We don't get any information from the magic signature, as this is just an indication of some form of memory corruption with all possible root causes you can imagine (a bug *somewhere*, memory corruption, faulty hardware, etc).<!----></span><br>If this is reproducible, that would be awesome! Otherwise it is not actionable.<span class="line"><!---->If this is reproducible, that would be awesome!         pthier@: As of Tuesday I've not been able to reproduce again by manually discarding tab via chrome://discards or by killing renderer process via Chrome's task manager.<span class="line"><!---->pthier@: As of Tuesday I've not been able to reproduce again by manually discarding tab via chrome://discards or by killing renderer process via Chrome's task manager.<!----></span><br><br>I'll try again with different states (energy saver on, off, etc.) next week, but was hoping crash report had some more info to narrow down repro or root cause.         I think this same issue repro'd again. Renderer process for 3 tabs crashed with error page saying STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION.<span class="line"><!---->I think this same issue repro'd again. Renderer process for 3 tabs crashed with error page saying STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION.<!----></span><br><br>Crash ID: 63eb14f806d68d9c<span class="line"><!---->Crash ID: 63eb14f806d68d9c<!----></span><br><br>Repro conditions:<span class="line"><!---->Repro conditions:<!----></span><br>I had 2 AWS Console tabs open (<span class="line"><!---->I had 2 AWS Console tabs open (<!----></span>https://us-east-2.console.aws.amazon.com/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://us-east-2.console.aws.amazon.com/"><!---->https://us-east-2.console.aws.amazon.com/<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> and opened a new tab, searched for "CloudWatch pricing" on Google, ctrl-clicked on first result (<span class="line"><!----> and opened a new tab, searched for "CloudWatch pricing" on Google, ctrl-clicked on first result (<!----></span>https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/pricing/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/pricing/"><!---->https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/pricing/<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> to open it on new tab, then switched to the 3rd tab using ctrl+tab. The page was rendered so the tab hadn't crashed yet at this point. Then I did one of the following (can't remember exactly): I either scrolled down or refreshed the page after it had loaded. Immediately after performing that action (one or both of: scrolling down or refreshing page), the STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION error appeared on the CloudWatch pricing tab and the other 2 AWS Console tabs I had open also crashed with same error (so I assume they shared the same renderer process since they're same-site).<span class="line"><!----> to open it on new tab, then switched to the 3rd tab using ctrl+tab. I'll try to repro this again now that I know it can happen more than once, but given I hadn't run into it in several weeks, seems unlikely I'll be able to intentionally repro again. And as you said, might be bad RAM or cosmic ray. (I haven't tested my RAM recently, will try to do so soon too to exclude that.)<span class="line"><!---->Let me know if there's any more info I can provide.           flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;

          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;

  h1, h2, h3, h4 {

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1426269: Security: Potential memory read issue when opening a second tab of a website
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1426269: Security: Potential memory read issue when opening a second tab of a website
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      alesa...@alesandroortiz.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2051716833" title="alesa...@alesandroortiz.com"><!---->alesa...@alesandroortiz.com<!----></a>
      alesa...@alesandroortiz.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->alesa...@alesandroortiz.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Mar 20, 2023)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This sounds like a potential memory issue based on observed behavior and<span class="line"><!---->This sounds like a potential memory issue based on observed behavior and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crbug.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crbug.com"><!---->crbug.com<!----></a> searches for similar crashes.<span class="line"><!----> searches for similar crashes.<!----></span><br>Found this on Stable, have crash dump and some context. Still trying to repro again.<span class="line"><!---->Found this on Stable, have crash dump and some context. Still trying to repro again.<!----></span><br><br>I had a background tab open on WebsiteA ("Tab 1") and an email tab on WebsiteB ("Tab 2"). I stepped away from laptop for 30-60 minutes (on Windows lockscreen the whole time).<span class="line"><!---->I had a background tab open on WebsiteA ("Tab 1") and an email tab on WebsiteB ("Tab 2"). I stepped away from laptop for 30-60 minutes (on Windows lockscreen the whole time).<!----></span><br>When I returned, from my email I opened a link to WebsiteA using ctrl+click (to open link in new background tab) which created "Tab 3". After a couple of seconds I switched to the new tab (Tab 3) for WebsiteA, and saw it was in a crashed state.<span class="line"><!---->When I returned, from my email I opened a link to WebsiteA using ctrl+click (to open link in new background tab) which created "Tab 3". After a couple of seconds I switched to the new tab (Tab 3) for WebsiteA, and saw it was in a crashed state.<!----></span><br><br>More interestingly, I then switched to the original tab for WebsiteA (Tab 1) and the page was blank (instead of an error page indicating a renderer kill). I then looked at Chrome's Task Manager to see if the renderer process for WebsiteA was still running, but as far as I could tell it was not (or at least not associated with the tab page's title). I refreshed the page which then loaded the original page on Tab 1 normally.<span class="line"><!---->More interestingly, I then switched to the original tab for WebsiteA (Tab 1) and the page was blank (instead of an error page indicating a renderer kill). I then looked at Chrome's Task Manager to see if the renderer process for WebsiteA was still running, but as far as I could tell it was not (or at least not associated with the tab page's title). I refreshed the page which then loaded the original page on Tab 1 normally.<!----></span><br><br>The blank page on Tab 1 suggests to me that the renderer for Tab 1 went away somehow either before or after the crash of Tab 3. How or why is a mystery. I suspect Tab 3 tried to use the renderer process for Tab 1 (as expected, since it's same origin), but since something happened to Tab 1's renderer process, that led to the bad memory read on Tab 3.<span class="line"><!---->The blank page on Tab 1 suggests to me that the renderer for Tab 1 went away somehow either before or after the crash of Tab 3. How or why is a mystery. I suspect Tab 3 tried to use the renderer process for Tab 1 (as expected, since it's same origin), but since something happened to Tab 1's renderer process, that led to the bad memory read on Tab 3.<!----></span><br><br>IIRC the error shown in the crashed Tab 3 was STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION (or something else which wasn't a breakpoint) which prompted me to look into it further.<span class="line"><!---->IIRC the error shown in the crashed Tab 3 was STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION (or something else which wasn't a breakpoint) which prompted me to look into it further.<!----></span><br><br>windbg !analyze output suggests a non-null read, but unsure why/where without symbolized stack trace (which I don't have because it was on Stable, not ASan). See attached windbg-analysis.txt for full output and attached dump.<span class="line"><!---->windbg !analyze output suggests a non-null read, but unsure why/where without symbolized stack trace (which I don't have because it was on Stable, not ASan). See attached windbg-analysis.txt for full output and attached dump.<!----></span><br><br>READ_ADDRESS:  000002e6015b0100 <span class="line"><!---->READ_ADDRESS:  000002e6015b0100 <!----></span><br><br>ERROR_CODE: (NTSTATUS) 0xc0000005 - The instruction at 0x%p referenced memory at 0x%p. The memory could not be %s.<span class="line"><!---->ERROR_CODE: (NTSTATUS) 0xc0000005 - The instruction at 0x%p referenced memory at 0x%p. The memory could not be %s.<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_CODE_STR:  c0000005<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_CODE_STR:  c0000005<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_PARAMETER1:  0000000000000000<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_PARAMETER1:  0000000000000000<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_PARAMETER2:  000002e6015b0100<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_PARAMETER2:  000002e6015b0100<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>FAILURE_BUCKET_ID:  INVALID_POINTER_READ_c0000005_chrome.dll!Unknown<span class="line"><!---->FAILURE_BUCKET_ID:  INVALID_POINTER_READ_c0000005_chrome.dll!Unknown<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 Stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 Stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2728)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2728)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>See description above for context. Don't have exact repro steps at the moment, but vaguely:<span class="line"><!---->See description above for context. Don't have exact repro steps at the moment, but vaguely:<!----></span><br>1. Open tab to WebsiteA ("Tab 1")<span class="line"><!---->1. Open tab to WebsiteA ("Tab 1")<!----></span><br>2. Open tab to WebsiteB ("Tab 2") with link to WebsiteA<span class="line"><!---->2. Open tab to WebsiteB ("Tab 2") with link to WebsiteA<!----></span><br>3. Wait (+ ???)<span class="line"><!---->3. Wait (+ ???)<!----></span><br>4. On WebsiteB (Tab 2), ctrl+click link to WebsiteA to open new background tab ("Tab 3")<span class="line"><!---->4. On WebsiteB (Tab 2), ctrl+click link to WebsiteA to open new background tab ("Tab 3")<!----></span><br>5. Switch to new background tab (Tab 3)<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch to new background tab (Tab 3)<!----></span><br><br>Observed: Tab 3 shows error page, Tab 1 is blank<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Tab 3 shows error page, Tab 1 is blank<!----></span><br>Expected: Page in Tab 3 loaded normally, Tab 1 is shown normally<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Page in Tab 3 loaded normally, Tab 1 is shown normally<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: Renderer (tab)<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: Renderer (tab)<!----></span><br>Crash State: Will attach dmp and windbg analysis in comment<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: Will attach dmp and windbg analysis in comment<!----></span><br>Client ID (if relevant): 795a64cb3813584e (crash ID from chrome://crashes)<span class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): 795a64cb3813584e (crash ID from chrome://crashes)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

The page was rendered so the tab hadn't crashed yet at this point. Then I did one of the following (can't remember exactly): I either scrolled down or refreshed the page after it had loaded. Immediately after performing that action (one or both of: scrolling down or refreshing page), the STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION error appeared on the CloudWatch pricing tab and the other 2 AWS Console tabs I had open also crashed with same error (so I assume they shared the same renderer process since they're same-site).<span class="line"><!----> to open it on new tab, then switched to the 3rd tab using ctrl+tab.          * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

          display: block;

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

          display: block;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

          <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">

          </chops-button>

        mr-issue-page {

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Mar 20, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Mar 20, 2023)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Mar 20, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Mar 20, 2023)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This sounds like a potential memory issue based on observed behavior and<span class="line"><!---->This sounds like a potential memory issue based on observed behavior and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crbug.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crbug.com"><!---->crbug.com<!----></a> searches for similar crashes.<span class="line"><!----> searches for similar crashes.<!----></span><br>Found this on Stable, have crash dump and some context. Still trying to repro again.<span class="line"><!---->Found this on Stable, have crash dump and some context. Still trying to repro again.<!----></span><br><br>I had a background tab open on WebsiteA ("Tab 1") and an email tab on WebsiteB ("Tab 2"). I stepped away from laptop for 30-60 minutes (on Windows lockscreen the whole time).<span class="line"><!---->I had a background tab open on WebsiteA ("Tab 1") and an email tab on WebsiteB ("Tab 2"). I stepped away from laptop for 30-60 minutes (on Windows lockscreen the whole time).<!----></span><br>When I returned, from my email I opened a link to WebsiteA using ctrl+click (to open link in new background tab) which created "Tab 3". After a couple of seconds I switched to the new tab (Tab 3) for WebsiteA, and saw it was in a crashed state.<span class="line"><!---->When I returned, from my email I opened a link to WebsiteA using ctrl+click (to open link in new background tab) which created "Tab 3". After a couple of seconds I switched to the new tab (Tab 3) for WebsiteA, and saw it was in a crashed state.<!----></span><br><br>More interestingly, I then switched to the original tab for WebsiteA (Tab 1) and the page was blank (instead of an error page indicating a renderer kill). I then looked at Chrome's Task Manager to see if the renderer process for WebsiteA was still running, but as far as I could tell it was not (or at least not associated with the tab page's title). I refreshed the page which then loaded the original page on Tab 1 normally.<span class="line"><!---->More interestingly, I then switched to the original tab for WebsiteA (Tab 1) and the page was blank (instead of an error page indicating a renderer kill). I then looked at Chrome's Task Manager to see if the renderer process for WebsiteA was still running, but as far as I could tell it was not (or at least not associated with the tab page's title). I refreshed the page which then loaded the original page on Tab 1 normally.<!----></span><br><br>The blank page on Tab 1 suggests to me that the renderer for Tab 1 went away somehow either before or after the crash of Tab 3. How or why is a mystery. I suspect Tab 3 tried to use the renderer process for Tab 1 (as expected, since it's same origin), but since something happened to Tab 1's renderer process, that led to the bad memory read on Tab 3.<span class="line"><!---->The blank page on Tab 1 suggests to me that the renderer for Tab 1 went away somehow either before or after the crash of Tab 3. How or why is a mystery. I suspect Tab 3 tried to use the renderer process for Tab 1 (as expected, since it's same origin), but since something happened to Tab 1's renderer process, that led to the bad memory read on Tab 3.<!----></span><br><br>IIRC the error shown in the crashed Tab 3 was STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION (or something else which wasn't a breakpoint) which prompted me to look into it further.<span class="line"><!---->IIRC the error shown in the crashed Tab 3 was STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION (or something else which wasn't a breakpoint) which prompted me to look into it further.<!----></span><br><br>windbg !analyze output suggests a non-null read, but unsure why/where without symbolized stack trace (which I don't have because it was on Stable, not ASan). See attached windbg-analysis.txt for full output and attached dump.<span class="line"><!---->windbg !analyze output suggests a non-null read, but unsure why/where without symbolized stack trace (which I don't have because it was on Stable, not ASan). See attached windbg-analysis.txt for full output and attached dump.<!----></span><br><br>READ_ADDRESS:  000002e6015b0100 <span class="line"><!---->READ_ADDRESS:  000002e6015b0100 <!----></span><br><br>ERROR_CODE: (NTSTATUS) 0xc0000005 - The instruction at 0x%p referenced memory at 0x%p. The memory could not be %s.<span class="line"><!---->ERROR_CODE: (NTSTATUS) 0xc0000005 - The instruction at 0x%p referenced memory at 0x%p. The memory could not be %s.<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_CODE_STR:  c0000005<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_CODE_STR:  c0000005<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_PARAMETER1:  0000000000000000<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_PARAMETER1:  0000000000000000<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_PARAMETER2:  000002e6015b0100<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_PARAMETER2:  000002e6015b0100<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>FAILURE_BUCKET_ID:  INVALID_POINTER_READ_c0000005_chrome.dll!Unknown<span class="line"><!---->FAILURE_BUCKET_ID:  INVALID_POINTER_READ_c0000005_chrome.dll!Unknown<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 Stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 Stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2728)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2728)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>See description above for context. Don't have exact repro steps at the moment, but vaguely:<span class="line"><!---->See description above for context. Don't have exact repro steps at the moment, but vaguely:<!----></span><br>1. Open tab to WebsiteA ("Tab 1")<span class="line"><!---->1. Open tab to WebsiteA ("Tab 1")<!----></span><br>2. Open tab to WebsiteB ("Tab 2") with link to WebsiteA<span class="line"><!---->2. Open tab to WebsiteB ("Tab 2") with link to WebsiteA<!----></span><br>3. Wait (+ ???)<span class="line"><!---->3. Wait (+ ???)<!----></span><br>4. On WebsiteB (Tab 2), ctrl+click link to WebsiteA to open new background tab ("Tab 3")<span class="line"><!---->4. On WebsiteB (Tab 2), ctrl+click link to WebsiteA to open new background tab ("Tab 3")<!----></span><br>5. Switch to new background tab (Tab 3)<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch to new background tab (Tab 3)<!----></span><br><br>Observed: Tab 3 shows error page, Tab 1 is blank<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Tab 3 shows error page, Tab 1 is blank<!----></span><br>Expected: Page in Tab 3 loaded normally, Tab 1 is shown normally<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Page in Tab 3 loaded normally, Tab 1 is shown normally<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: Renderer (tab)<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: Renderer (tab)<!----></span><br>Crash State: Will attach dmp and windbg analysis in comment<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: Will attach dmp and windbg analysis in comment<!----></span><br>Client ID (if relevant): 795a64cb3813584e (crash ID from chrome://crashes)<span class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): 795a64cb3813584e (crash ID from chrome://crashes)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

The page was rendered so the tab hadn't crashed yet at this point. Then I did one of the following (can't remember exactly): I either scrolled down or refreshed the page after it had loaded. Immediately after performing that action (one or both of: scrolling down or refreshing page), the STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION error appeared on the CloudWatch pricing tab and the other 2 AWS Console tabs I had open also crashed with same error (so I assume they shared the same renderer process since they're same-site).<span class="line"><!----> to open it on new tab, then switched to the 3rd tab using ctrl+tab.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>

        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>

          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1426269: Security: Potential memory read issue when opening a second tab of a website
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1426269: Security: Potential memory read issue when opening a second tab of a website
          </h1>
          
            Reported by

        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Mar 20, 2023)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This sounds like a potential memory issue based on observed behavior and<span class="line"><!---->This sounds like a potential memory issue based on observed behavior and<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crbug.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crbug.com"><!---->crbug.com<!----></a> searches for similar crashes.<span class="line"><!----> searches for similar crashes.<!----></span><br>Found this on Stable, have crash dump and some context. Still trying to repro again.<span class="line"><!---->Found this on Stable, have crash dump and some context. Still trying to repro again.<!----></span><br><br>I had a background tab open on WebsiteA ("Tab 1") and an email tab on WebsiteB ("Tab 2"). I stepped away from laptop for 30-60 minutes (on Windows lockscreen the whole time).<span class="line"><!---->I had a background tab open on WebsiteA ("Tab 1") and an email tab on WebsiteB ("Tab 2"). I stepped away from laptop for 30-60 minutes (on Windows lockscreen the whole time).<!----></span><br>When I returned, from my email I opened a link to WebsiteA using ctrl+click (to open link in new background tab) which created "Tab 3". After a couple of seconds I switched to the new tab (Tab 3) for WebsiteA, and saw it was in a crashed state.<span class="line"><!---->When I returned, from my email I opened a link to WebsiteA using ctrl+click (to open link in new background tab) which created "Tab 3". After a couple of seconds I switched to the new tab (Tab 3) for WebsiteA, and saw it was in a crashed state.<!----></span><br><br>More interestingly, I then switched to the original tab for WebsiteA (Tab 1) and the page was blank (instead of an error page indicating a renderer kill). I then looked at Chrome's Task Manager to see if the renderer process for WebsiteA was still running, but as far as I could tell it was not (or at least not associated with the tab page's title). I refreshed the page which then loaded the original page on Tab 1 normally.<span class="line"><!---->More interestingly, I then switched to the original tab for WebsiteA (Tab 1) and the page was blank (instead of an error page indicating a renderer kill). I then looked at Chrome's Task Manager to see if the renderer process for WebsiteA was still running, but as far as I could tell it was not (or at least not associated with the tab page's title). I refreshed the page which then loaded the original page on Tab 1 normally.<!----></span><br><br>The blank page on Tab 1 suggests to me that the renderer for Tab 1 went away somehow either before or after the crash of Tab 3. How or why is a mystery. I suspect Tab 3 tried to use the renderer process for Tab 1 (as expected, since it's same origin), but since something happened to Tab 1's renderer process, that led to the bad memory read on Tab 3.<span class="line"><!---->The blank page on Tab 1 suggests to me that the renderer for Tab 1 went away somehow either before or after the crash of Tab 3. How or why is a mystery. I suspect Tab 3 tried to use the renderer process for Tab 1 (as expected, since it's same origin), but since something happened to Tab 1's renderer process, that led to the bad memory read on Tab 3.<!----></span><br><br>IIRC the error shown in the crashed Tab 3 was STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION (or something else which wasn't a breakpoint) which prompted me to look into it further.<span class="line"><!---->IIRC the error shown in the crashed Tab 3 was STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION (or something else which wasn't a breakpoint) which prompted me to look into it further.<!----></span><br><br>windbg !analyze output suggests a non-null read, but unsure why/where without symbolized stack trace (which I don't have because it was on Stable, not ASan). See attached windbg-analysis.txt for full output and attached dump.<span class="line"><!---->windbg !analyze output suggests a non-null read, but unsure why/where without symbolized stack trace (which I don't have because it was on Stable, not ASan). See attached windbg-analysis.txt for full output and attached dump.<!----></span><br><br>READ_ADDRESS:  000002e6015b0100 <span class="line"><!---->READ_ADDRESS:  000002e6015b0100 <!----></span><br><br>ERROR_CODE: (NTSTATUS) 0xc0000005 - The instruction at 0x%p referenced memory at 0x%p. The memory could not be %s.<span class="line"><!---->ERROR_CODE: (NTSTATUS) 0xc0000005 - The instruction at 0x%p referenced memory at 0x%p. The memory could not be %s.<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_CODE_STR:  c0000005<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_CODE_STR:  c0000005<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_PARAMETER1:  0000000000000000<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_PARAMETER1:  0000000000000000<!----></span><br><br>EXCEPTION_PARAMETER2:  000002e6015b0100<span class="line"><!---->EXCEPTION_PARAMETER2:  000002e6015b0100<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>FAILURE_BUCKET_ID:  INVALID_POINTER_READ_c0000005_chrome.dll!Unknown<span class="line"><!---->FAILURE_BUCKET_ID:  INVALID_POINTER_READ_c0000005_chrome.dll!Unknown<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 Stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 111.0.5563.65 Stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2728)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10 Version 21H2 (Build 19044.2728)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>See description above for context. Don't have exact repro steps at the moment, but vaguely:<span class="line"><!---->See description above for context. Don't have exact repro steps at the moment, but vaguely:<!----></span><br>1. Open tab to WebsiteA ("Tab 1")<span class="line"><!---->1. Open tab to WebsiteA ("Tab 1")<!----></span><br>2. Open tab to WebsiteB ("Tab 2") with link to WebsiteA<span class="line"><!---->2. Open tab to WebsiteB ("Tab 2") with link to WebsiteA<!----></span><br>3. Wait (+ ???)<span class="line"><!---->3. Wait (+ ???)<!----></span><br>4. On WebsiteB (Tab 2), ctrl+click link to WebsiteA to open new background tab ("Tab 3")<span class="line"><!---->4. On WebsiteB (Tab 2), ctrl+click link to WebsiteA to open new background tab ("Tab 3")<!----></span><br>5. Switch to new background tab (Tab 3)<span class="line"><!---->5. Switch to new background tab (Tab 3)<!----></span><br><br>Observed: Tab 3 shows error page, Tab 1 is blank<span class="line"><!---->Observed: Tab 3 shows error page, Tab 1 is blank<!----></span><br>Expected: Page in Tab 3 loaded normally, Tab 1 is shown normally<span class="line"><!---->Expected: Page in Tab 3 loaded normally, Tab 1 is shown normally<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: Renderer (tab)<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: Renderer (tab)<!----></span><br>Crash State: Will attach dmp and windbg analysis in comment<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: Will attach dmp and windbg analysis in comment<!----></span><br>Client ID (if relevant): 795a64cb3813584e (crash ID from chrome://crashes)<span class="line"><!---->Client ID (if relevant): 795a64cb3813584e (crash ID from chrome://crashes)<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz <<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Alesandro Ortiz &lt;<!----></span>https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://AlesandroOrtiz.com"><!---->https://AlesandroOrtiz.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

The page was rendered so the tab hadn't crashed yet at this point. Then I did one of the following (can't remember exactly): I either scrolled down or refreshed the page after it had loaded. Immediately after performing that action (one or both of: scrolling down or refreshing page), the STATUS_ACCESS_VIOLATION error appeared on the CloudWatch pricing tab and the other 2 AWS Console tabs I had open also crashed with same error (so I assume they shared the same renderer process since they're same-site).<span class="line"><!----> to open it on new tab, then switched to the 3rd tab using ctrl+tab.           <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

          flex-direction: column;

          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      
      
        
          
      
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Mar 20, 2023)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by alesa...@alesandroortiz.com (Mar 20, 2023)
      </option>
